title: penarth man ordered repay   selling counterfeit goods
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communitySean Payter was convicted in  following a Trading Standards investigation for the Vale of Glamorgan Council and today faced a Proceeds of Crime Hearing.There the judge decided he must repay a signicant sum gained from his illegal activity over the next three months.Shared Regulatory Services , who undertake trading standards work across the Local Authority areas of Bridgend, Cardf and the Vale, began investigating Mr Payter after receiving a complaint from the Assay Office, the body responsible for testing and hallmarking precious metals.The Assay Office had carried out a test purchase from gemgems, a company operated by Payter and Stefan Hodgson from Newport, that sold jewellery on eBay.It revealed that an item was not silver as described and did not contain the advertised gem stones.Further testing by SRS found that other items of jewellery were also misdescribed and that cosmetics being sold were unsafe and possibly infringed trademarks.After executing a warrant for the home of Payter, SRS officers seized jewellery, cosmetics and pound, in cash.The investigation showed that Payter and Hodgson had been trading for five years and at one point ran a website calledgemsgems.MORE NEWS:Check out these photos of the ambitious transformation at Whitmore High SchoolNew Pathway College announced at University of South WalesOutdoor show to come to Barrys MEMO Arts Centre later this month!They had been buying items such as necklaces, bracelets, bangles and earrings from a website in China without verying that they were as described.Counterfeit cufflinks and belts were also identied along with cosmetics that werenrsquot safe to be used.Payter, from St Davids Cresent in Penarth and Hodgson, of Park Drive Newport, both plead guilty to  offences in total two under Consumer Protection from Unfair Trading Regulations, six under the Hallmarking Act, two under Cosmetic Product Enforcement Regulations and two under the Trademarks Act.     In August  they were sentenced to a total of  months in prison, reduced to  months for early guilty pleas, suspended for  months. The pair also had to pay a victim surcharge of pound each.Cllr Eddie Williams, Vale of Glamorgan Council Cabinet Member for Legal, Regulatory and Planning Services, said: ldquoThis was a despicable operation that took money from members of the public for items that were not what they purported to be."Great work by Shared Regulatory Services has led to this prosecution, which ensures that no more people will fall victim to this company.ldquoI welcome the signicant sum Mr Payter has been told to repay, which reflects the amount of money he made from the operation.ldquoThis case should serve as a warning to others operating illegally within our community. The Council will actively look to protect our residents and will not hesitate to take actionwe find people are not operating within the parameters of the law. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: mcdonalds scrap popular items menu make way  new offerings
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFast food lovers will know, the UKrsquos most popular burger chain regularly updates its menu throughout the year with promotions to keep their offerings fresh.From this week, McDonaldrsquos has unveiled five new items that will be available to customers until mid-June.The new products will be part of the chains menu from May  to June  meaning you will only have a short time to sample their new offerings.One of the items making ais a firm favourite among McDonaldrsquos lovers, the Bacon Clubhouse Double.The burger consists of two % beef patties, two rashers of Beechwood smoked bacon, a slice of cheddar cheese, onions, tomato, lettuce, and sauce.Another item being added to the menu is the Chicken Deluxe Sandwich.A chicken option consisting of two crunchy Chicken Selects, Emmental cheese, lettuce, red onions, tomato relish, and mayonnaise. Both items will cost pound. each." alt"Penarth Times: Two new burgers will be making ato the menu. " class"editor-image"Two new burgers will be making ato the menu. Another item making ato the menu is the Cheese and Herb Melts. Priced at pound., the cheesy treats come in a pack of five and accompanied with a delicious tomato and herb sauce.McDonaldrsquos is also mixing it up with their McFlurryrsquos with Galaxy and Galaxy Caramel flavours making ato the menu.Both feature Galaxy chocolate chunks with either chocolate or caramel sauce and cost pound..Now that you have had the good news, to make way for the new items McDonaldrsquos is having to scrap a number of items that have proven popular with customers.One of which is the Big Tasty burger which was removed on May  alongside the Chicken BBQ Smokehouse burger.To make way for the Galaxy McFlurryrsquos, McDonaldrsquos has also revealed the Cadbury Cregraveme Egg and the Cadbury Caramel flavours are being scrapped.The items were reintroduced to the McDonaldrsquos menu in March when customers were warned they would only be available until May.However, with how often the menu changes it is likely customers will see them make ato the menu sometime in the future. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments are closed on this article. -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: senedd election  vaughan gething retains seat
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local community.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething at the count for the Senedd elections iltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgtn the House of Sportltspan classtruncate-full-screengt, Cardf today.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Senedd Election : Vaughan Gething retains Cardf South and Penarth seat.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething with his son and we celebrating afterltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgt winning Cardf Soultspan classtruncate-full-screengtth and Penarth during the count for the Senedd elections in the House of Sport, Cardf.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Senedd Election : Vaughan Gething retains Cardf South and Penarth seat.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething celebrating after winning Cardf Southltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgt and Penarth during ltspan classtruncate-full-screengtthe count for the Senedd elections in the House of Sport, Cardf.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentVAUGHAN Gething has retained his seat in the Senedd.Mr Gething, who has represented Cardf South and Penarth since , has secured his seat by a majority of more than , votes.The Labour representative received , votes."Im delighted with the result," he said."A really strong showing across Cardf South and Penarth. When we saw the boxes being opened in Penarth we also saw there was a very strong showing there."It was hard to tell how all of the votes scattered amongst the fringe parties, but in the main parties it was clear that we were going to have a good result."When asked about what is in store for next term, he said: "Well we need to see what the national results are, and Ive still got choices to make as the health minister until a new government is formed."Some of those are still big and dficult, and I think its part of the reason why people renwed their faith in us and that is because they recognise there are still challenges to navigate our way through."But I really do look forward to within tis next term being able to see people in a more normal way - to go to more community events and have more of the person to person contact weve all missed in this last year and more."This year saw a sizeable increase in voter turnout with , votes cast- . per cent - compared to . per cent in .The full results for Cardf South and Penarth are as follows:Vaughan Gething- ,Leighton Rowlands- ,Nasir Adam- ,Helen Westhead- ,Alex Wilson- ,Paul Campbell- Lisa Peregrine- Matt Friend- Alan Pick- Alan Golding- David Rolfe- Angus Hawkins-  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: exhausted doctors felt pressured work extra shifts   survey
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe British Medical Associationsaid more than half of doctorssurveyed in the UK had worked extra shts as part of the Covid- response, of which % were unpaid.The BMArsquos Covid- tracker survey in April also revealed % of doctors felt pressured by their employer to work additional hours.Of the , doctors who responded to the survey, more than a thirdsaid they had either skipped taking full breaks or taken them on rare occasions, with nearly % reporting a higher than normal level of fatigue or exhaustion.Dr Chaand Nagpaul, BMA council chairman, said: ldquoTo learn that an already depleted and now exhausted workforce feels forced into doing more and more hours, with many reporting higher levels of fatigue than ever, is extremely worrying.ldquoIt is putting them at risk and their patients.ldquoWorking lsquoflat outrsquo without a change to rest and recuperate is simply unsustainable and unsafe.ldquoThe results from the latest BMArsquos Covid- tracker survey show that far too many colleagues across the NHS are experiencing unacceptable levels of exhaustion while being pressured to work extra shts, and this needs to be addressed as a matter of urgency.ldquoGovernments should be doing all they can to ensure staff have an opportunity to rest and reset ndash no-one should feel pressured to take the NHS backlogs on a goodwill basis. vw,vw,px, px"The findings echoed figures from the Royal College of Nursingrsquossurvey in July , which found a third of nursing staff in all sectors reported they are working longer hours.RCN acting chief executive and general secretary Pat Cullen said: ldquoExhausted health and care staff, without whom we would not have turned the tide of the pandemic, must be supported to recover.     ldquoWe cannotto the understaffed wards, care homes and clinics from before the pandemic. Investment in staffing and pay is about both patient safety and the health of our workers.ldquoAfter this experience, nursing staff expect decisive action and investment to guarantee there are enough highly skilled healthcare workers to meet our countryrsquos needs now and in the future.ldquoThat means leaders must take steps to retain the nursing staff we have, as well as to increase entry into the profession.A spokesperson from NHS England said: ldquoLocal areas should be ensuring that staff are getting the support they need and the NHS has recently set up  mental health hubs, providing doctors and other healthcare workers with free, rapid access to local mental health services in addition to increasing access toonline supportand helplinesduringthe pandemic..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title:  uExhausted u doctors felt pressured to work extra shts  u survey article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: snp second referendum bid irresponsible says eustice vote counting resumes
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFirst Minister Nicola Sturgeon has vowed to plough ahead with plans for a follow-up border poll as her partyrsquos chances of taking more than  seats in the Scottish Parliament remained in the balance as counting resumed on Saturday.With the SNP leaderrsquos strategy putting her on a collision course with the Prime Minister, who has insisted he would not support an ldquoirresponsible referendum, senior minister George Eustice said it was the wrong time to be considering another plebiscite.ldquoWe think this is a complete distraction, Mr Eustice told Times Radio.ldquoIt would be irresponsible to have another isive referendum and another bout of constitutional debate at a time when we are charting our way out of this pandemic and when wersquove got to really focus on economic recovery.ldquoWe think itrsquos completely the wrong thing to be doing.ldquoWe had a referendum just a little over five years ago and that settled the issue.His comments come after Boris Johnson told the Dailyanother referendum would be ldquoirresponsible and reckless in the ldquocurrent context as Britain emerges from the coronavirus crisis.The Environment Secretary looked to sht the conversation away from there being a clash in the courts between No  and the SNP over the issue.Asked whether the Government would fight any bid for a second Scottish referendum in the courts, he told BBC Breakfast: ldquoLook, Irsquom not a lawyer ndash lawyers will look at these things and I think it is getting ahead of ourselves. vw,vw,px, px"ldquoThere is a question at the moment over whether the SNP will get a majority or not ndash wersquoll have to wait and see until the results come through.Scotlandrsquos Deputy First Minister John Swinney said he was ldquovery confident Holyrood would emerge from the Super Thursday elections with a pro-independence majority, eventhe SNP falls short of winning more than  seats.     Currently,  of the  constituency results in Scotland have been declared, with the SNP winning  seats, the Liberal Democrats four, the Conservatives three and Labour two.The SNP picked up key seats in Edinburgh Central, Ayr and East Lothian, and heldon to Aberdeenshire East, which was the first result to be announced on Saturday, against a Tory challenge.But under Holyroodrsquos proportional representation system, those successes could see it lose out on the regional list which make up the remaining  seats.Some constituencies are still to be counted on Saturday, when the crucial regional list results will also be declared. vw,vw,px, px"Votes are still being counted throughout Saturday Mr Swinney told the BBC: ldquoI think what matters on the question you asked me about, a mandate for a referendum is what is the position of those who are elected to the Parliament and will there be an overall majority of members elected committed to the hosting of an independence referendum, and Irsquom very confident that will be the case.In England, the post-mortem into Labourrsquos poor showing at the polls has continued as a senior party figure said it was evident after the Hartlepool by-election defeat and local election losses that voters ldquodo not now see Labour as answering their concerns.Shadow home secretary Nick Thomas-Symonds said there would be a policy review to ldquomake surehellip our party is connected in communities up and down the country.He said it would be up to leader Sir Keir Starmer ndash who called the results ldquobitterly disappointing ndash on whether to embark on a reshuffle of his top team but there was a ldquowider, more fundamental issue at play for the party than personnel changes.Labour will be hoping for better results on Saturday after a bruising Friday which, as well as Hartlepool turning blue for the first time in a generation, saw the party lose by a landslide to the Tories in the Tees Valley mayoral battle. vw,vw,px, px"Shadow home secretary Nick Thomas-Symonds As of Saturday afternoon, with results in from  of  English councils, the Tories had a net gain of eight authorities and  seats, while Labour had a net loss of four councils and  seats.In Londonrsquos mayoral contest, Labourrsquos Sadiq Khan goes into Saturday with a lead of , first preference votes over Tory rival Shaun Bailey after the first seven constituencies declared, a closer contest than many had predicted.The other mayoral contests will also be keenly watched ndash Andy Burnhamrsquos profile in Greater Manchester has seen him become the bookmakersrsquo favourite to replace Sir Keir as the next Labour leader, even though he is not in the Commons.In the West Midlands, Andy Street will be looking to complete the Tory ldquohat-trick of successes by retaining the mayoralty, following Jill Mortimerrsquos Hartlepool victory and Ben Houchenrsquos stunning result which saw him take % of the vote in Tees Valley. vw,vw,px, px"First Minister Mark Drakeford was re-elected as Cardf West MS In Wales ndash as in Scotland and England ndash the party in power during the pandemic appears to have been rewarded by the voters.Mark Drakefordrsquos Welsh Labour avoided the kind of electoral drubbing Sir Keir endured on Friday, holding on to its ldquored wall seats in the north.With the final results still to come, Labour has exactly half the  seats in the Senedd, equalling its best ever results.Results so far have seen Labour win , the Tories , Plaid Cymru nine and the Liberal Democrats one.Mr Drakeford, who extended the majority for his Cardf West seat by more than , votes, said he was delighted his party had ldquoexceeded expectations..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: SNP second referendum bid irresponsible, says Eustice as vote counting resumes article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey title: leonardo da vinci drawing expected fetch m auction

These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe picture, titled Head Of A Bear, is being sold in London by the Christiersquos auction house.It will go on display in New York and Hong Kong before being auctioned.It is expected to fetch between pound million and pound million, according to Christiersquos.Ben Hall, old master paintings chairman at Christiersquos New York, described the drawing as ldquoone of the most important works from the Renaissance still in private hands.He added: ldquoThe work has been owned by some of the most distinguished collectors in the field of old masters across many centuries, not least the present owner who has owned it since .ldquoIt has been admired around the world whilst shown by prestigious museums and Christiersquos is honoured to bring this Leonardo to the market this season.Head Of A Bear, which measures cm squared, is a silverpoint drawing on pale pink-beige paper.It has previously gone on display at museums including Londonrsquos National Gallery, where it was shown in  and  as part of an exhibition on Da Vinci.The drawing will be shown in London from June  to  before it is title: travel firms hail best day holiday sales months green list announced
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityOn Friday, the Department for Transport revealed that travellers will be able to visit  destinations ndash including Portugal ndash from May  without having to self-isolate onto England.Tui, the UKrsquos largest holiday company, spoke of seeing a rise in customer demand in the wake of the announcement, particularly for trips to Portugal.A spokeswoman said: ldquoWersquove had the best day of sales for summer  holidays since the initial road map announcement in February.ldquoSixty per cent of all holidays sold yesterday were to Portugal.The firm said new flights and extra holidays have been added for people who want to ldquoget away as quickly as possible.Hays Travel, the UKrsquos largest independent travel agent, said the earlier speculation around the announcement prompted its ldquobusiest week since the pandemic began.Dame Irene Hays, chair of Hays Travel, said:ldquoThis week, Hays Travel branches all over the UK have been at their busiest since the pandemic began, helping our customers to book a holiday for when and where itrsquos safe to do so.ldquoMore customers are now booking for this year to make sure they donrsquot miss out on choice or price.She added: ldquoAnd they are choosing to spend a little more, treating themselves to better destinations or accommodation, or finally booking that bucket list dream holiday.But other smaller firms labelled the green list announcement a ldquodamp squib, saying there are not enough destinations to spark a real surge in bookings.Mark Pollard, managing director of Tony Sheldon Travel in Maidenhead, told the PA news agency: ldquoOne of the problems with this list is itrsquos very limiting, the only major tourist destination is Portugal, this is all too little and too early to say.ldquoItrsquos a damp squib announcement, there isnrsquot enough there to prompt the kind of interest the industry is desperate for.     ldquoI think itrsquos more of a tick box announcement to just give us some destinations and keep us all happy.Mr Pollard added: ldquoI really donrsquot think this will make a huge dference until more of the top European holiday destinations are added on to the list ndash but again, itrsquos too early to tell at the moment..push,i[r].l*new These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityMr Aiken will remain in the position until a successor is chosen.The announcement from the South Antrim MLA comes amid growing internal UUP concern at his leadership.Mr Aiken, a former submarine captain, was elected to the position unopposed in .In a letter to party chairman Danny Kennedy, he said he believed he had taken the party as far as he could.ldquoTo achieve our goals, we now need new leadership, he wrote.Mr Aiken said he will remain in politics and continue as a South Antrim MLA.He wrote: ldquoMay I say what a privilege it has been to lead our party in these dficult and trying times while leadership of a political party has many highs and lows, it has been my work with our elected representatives, in particular our MLA team, that has given me the greatest confidence for the future of our great party..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Steve Aiken resigns as Ulster Unionist Party leader article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice.
